newsitem.title: UK: UK's FTSE falls for sixth day, dogged by rate woes.
newsitem.headline: UK's FTSE falls for sixth day, dogged by rate woes.

text.p: UK shares finished lower for the sixth consecutive session on Monday, dogged by a deterioration in the domestic and U.S. interest rate outlook and continuing nervousness in the run-up to the UK election.

The leading FTSE 100 index ended 40.0 points lower at 4,214.8, its lowest level for two months. Since market sentiment turned sour at the beginning of last week, the FTSE has had 4.7 pct, or 209 points sliced off its value.
"The market has become very nervous," commented one trader. "We may come back to 4,150 as part of this correction."
